alert.note: Alert for Lewis; Pierce (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued November 04 at 7:14PM PDT until November 05 at 10:19PM PDT by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Washington... Nisqually River Near National affecting Pierce and Lewis Counties. .Six and one half inches of rain has already fallen in Mount Rainier National Park Friday with another one to two inches forecast before the rain comes to an end Saturday morning. This amount of rain will push the Nisqually River near National into moderate flood stage. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Nisqually River Near National. * WHEN...From this evening to late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 10,000.0 cfs, the Nisqually River will flood along the upper reaches of the river from Mt Rainier National Park downstream to Alder Lake. Swift waters will flood roads...pasture lands...and farms. Erosion may damage the river banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 PM PDT Friday the flow was 7,140.0 cfs. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 13,360 cfs late tonight. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday afternoon. - Flood flow is 8,000.0 cfs. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by late tonight at 315 AM PDT.
